content.description: Stand start on a pad or two with a decent, left, crescent-shaped crimp and a barely there, right hand bump. Pull up, move straight up, and top out.
content.location: This is on the backside, about 10 feet right of the problem Firing Squad.

content.description: Stand start the far right steep arête n the main face of the boulder with a high left sloper and a lower right crimp. Move up and left to a tough topout.
content.location: It is on the second significant boulder on the left side of the trail, about 10 minutes from the parking lot.

content.description: This slabby problem climbs an inconspicuous arete on the rear of the boulder to a decent jug.  It is fairly technical at the grade.  Keep your eye out for a helpful two finger crimp.
content.protection: Pads. It has a good landing. Downclimb a tree.
content.location: On the rear of the boulder, look for a dark area at waist height where a large, loose flake was pried off.  Use one end of this for your left hand, and reach up for the decent rail on your right.  Shimmy upward on not great feet.

content.description: Sit start as for the problem Total Recall, but move up, traverse right, and finish up the steep arete.
content.location:
It is on the second significant boulder on the left side of the trail.

 It is about a 10 minute walk from the parking lot.

content.description: Sit start on the cool, obvious, slopey shelves, move up, and then traverse left to a slopey topout.
content.location: This is on the second significant boulder you come to on the left side of the trail. It is a 10 minute walk from the parking lot.

content.description: Squat start with left hand on a bad low side pull and right hand on a decent slightly incut circular crimp. Pop to the decent flake with your left hand, and move up and left to top out.
content.location: Start roughly between the problems Band of Brothers and Total Recall.

content.description: Sit start with right in a small crimpy gaston and left in a lower shallow scoop. Move left to the flake, and the make a few balancy moves before topping out.
content.location: Start several feet right of the far left end of the main face.

content.description: Stand start with small left crimp and faint right hand pocket. Pull off holds, get feet up, balance, and throw right hand to the lip. Move slightly right to top out.
content.location: This is on the backside of the boulder.

content.description: This climbs a cool, right-slanting scoop. Step up awkwardly into the scoop, and smear upward using the inverted rail for your left hand.  This is harder than it looks.
content.location: This is located the obvious scoop feature on the the lower angle face that partly faces the path.  Use the crimp to step up into the scoop, and head right underneath the inverted rail.

content.description: Sit start with left hand on a small crimp at the top of the feature and your right hand in a one finger pod pinch. Get your feet pasted to the wall, pull up,  fire to the distant flake out right, match, and then move up and left to a slopey topout.
content.location: Start on the feature about 4 feet to the right of the far left end of the main steep face.

content.description: Sit start as for the problem A Small Dose of Religion, but head up and right traversing the slopey lip, and top out around the corner.
content.location: Start on the short face that faces the trail.

content.description: Sit start on the ground without a pad with hands on small crimps and decent feet. Bump your right hand to a rounded crimp. Then bump your right again to the slopey arête. Move left to a cool topout.
content.location: This problem faces the main trail and is about 8-10 feet from it.

content.description: This is a good-sized block with several problems. The main attraction is the long, steep overhanging wall.
